00028 /* IFVerticallyExpandingTextField 
00029 
00030 Published at:
00031 
00032 http://www.cocoadev.com/index.pl?IFVerticallyExpandingTextField
00033 
00034 This textfield expands and contracts as it is edited and resized, and behaves
00035 in a similar manner to the input field in Apple's iChat message windows.
00036 
00037 Superviews of the textfield and the window containing the textfield autosize 
00038 accordingly.
00039 
00040 Give it a try! You should be able to throw this into a project, read the files in
00041 Interface Builder, and use the custom class pane to make an NSTextField into an
00042 IFVerticallyExpandingTextField. You'll need to set the layout and linebreaking
00043 attributes for word wrapping for this to work.
00044 
00045 Although expansion should work properly when the textfield is embedded in a subview,
00046 I'm having some trouble dealing with NSScrollViews. The field expands into the
00047 scrollview's content view, but none of the controls on the scrollbar appear.
00048 Some help here would be appreciated.
00049 
00050 Added the setStringValue method, can't believe I forgot that. In my test
00051 application I thought I saw a noticeable difference in speed when calling setString
00052 on the field editor rather than setStringValue on super, but maybe it was just my
00053 imagination. Can anyone confirm this?
00054 
00055 Also added a slight time delay in this method to prevent display problems when autosizing.
00056 
00057 Added the setHidden method. I haven't tested this one out, so I don't know what the
00058 consequences are if the field is set visible when a view has been moved up to where the
00059 field should be.
00060 
00061 */
00062
